column1: JINYA Ramen Bar - Houston////We got to try both the Tonkotsu Black and White
column2: with the main difference being the broth. Black was thick and flavorful while White was light and smooth. I personally prefer the White more but you won't go wrong with either one. The thin noodles had the right level of consistency and chewiness. And FINALLY
column3: someone in Houston got the chashu right -- flaky
column5: chashu. BAM! The rest of the toppings were above average with the soft-boiled egg being the highlight.
